gurmukhi: fyro prY iqn ko ju jhwN lG Gyrn kI ndIAw auT DwvY ] qyj cly hhrwt kIey Aiq hI icq S`qRn ky fru pwvY ]
transliteration: Dero Darai Tin Ko Ju Jahaan Lagh Gderan Kinadeeaa Outh Dhaavai|| Tej Chale Hahraat Keee At(i) Hichit Shattran Ke Dar(u) Paavai||
translation: Wherever their tents were pitched, there the soldiers rushed forth like the river-flood; on account of the speedy and thumping gait of the soldiers, the minds of the enemies were getting fearful;

gurmukhi: pwrsI bol mlyC khY rn qy tir kY pgu eyk n AwvY ] sXwm jU ko tuk hyir khY sr eyk hI sau jm lok pTwvY ]1906]
transliteration: Paarsibol Malechh Kahai Ran Te Tar(i) Kai Pag(u) Ek Na Aavai|| Syaam Joo Ko Touk Her(i) Kahai Sar Ek Hisau Jam Lok Pathaavai||
translation: The malechhas were saying in Persian language that they would not retrace even one step in the war and on seeing Krishna, they would dispatch him to the abode of Yama with a single arrow only.1906.

gurmukhi: Agny ieq kop mlyC cVy auq isMDjrw bhu lY dlu AwXo ] pqR skY bn kY gn kY koaU jwiq n ko pwr n pwXo ]
transliteration: Agne It Kop Malechh Chade Out Sindhjaraa Bahu Lai Dal(u) Aayo|| Patra Sakai Ban Kai Gad Kai Ko( i)  Jaat(i) Na Ko Kachhu Paar Na Paayo||
translation: On this side, the malechhas advanced in great fury, and on the other side Jrasandh came with a huge army; the leaves of the trees can be counted, but this army cannot be estimated;

gurmukhi: biRj nwiek bwrunI pIqo huqo qh hI iqn dUqn jwie sunwXo ] Aaur ju hÍY fru pRwn qjY ieq sRI jdubIr mhwN suKu pwXo ]1907]
transliteration: Brij Naaik Baarounipeeto Houto Tah Hitin Dootan Jaae Sounaayo|| Aur Ju Hvai Dar(u) Praan Tajai It Srijadoubeer Mahaan Soukh(u) Paayo||1907||
translation: The messengers while drinking the wine, told about the latest situation to Krishna; though all others were filled with fear and agitation, but Krishna felt extremely pleased on listening to the news.1907.

gurmukhi: ieq kop mlyC cVy Agny auq AwXo lY isMDjrw dl Bwro ] Awvq hY gjrwj bny mno Awvq hY aumfXo Gn kwro ]
transliteration: It Kop Malechh Chade Agne Out Aayo Lai Sindhjaraa Dal Bdaro|| Oovat Hai Gadraaj Bade Mano Aavat Hai Oumdyo Ghan Daro||
translation: On this side, the malechhas rushed forward in great fury, and the other Jarasandh reached there with his huge army; all were marching like intoxicated elephants and appeared like the rushing dark clouds;

gurmukhi: sXwm hlI mQurw hI ky BIqr Gyr ley js sXwm aucwro ] Syr bfy doaU Gyr ley bhu bIrn ko mno ky kir bwro ]1908]
transliteration: Syaam Halimathuraa Hike Bheetar Gher Lae Jas Syaam Oucdaro|| Sher Bade Dooo Gher Lae Badoo Bderan Ko Mano Kai Kar(i) Daro||1908||
translation: Krishna and Balram were surrounded within Matura and it seemed that considering other warriors as children, these two great lions were besieged.1908.

gurmukhi: kwl hlI sB SsqR sMBwr kY kRoD Gno icq bIr ibcwrXo ] sYn mlyCn ko jh Qo iqh Er hI sXwm BnY pg DwrXo ]
transliteration: Kaal Halisabh Shastra Sanbhaar Kai Krodh Ghano Chit Beer Bichdaryo|| Sain Malechhan Ko Jah Tho Tih Or Hisyaam Bhanai Pag Dhdaryo||
translation: Balram became highly infuriated and held up his weapons; he advanced to the side where was the army of malechhas;

gurmukhi: pRwn kIey ibn bIr Gny Gn Gwiel kY Gnu sUrn fwrXo ] nYk sMBwr rhI n iqnY ieh BwNq so sXwm jU XO dlu mwrXo ]1909]
transliteration: Praan Keee Bin Beer Ghane Ghan Ghaail Kai Ghan(u) Sooran Ddaryo|| Naik Sanbhaar Rahina Tinai Eh Bhaant So Syaam Joo Yau Dal(u) Mdaryo||1909||
translation: He made many warriors lifeless and knocked down many after wounding them; Krishna destroyed the enemy’s army in such a manner, that none remained in senses, even slightly.1909.

gurmukhi: eyk pro Bt Gwiel hoie Dr eyk pry ibn pRwn hI mwry ] pwie pry iqn ky su kty khUM hwQ pr iqn ky khUM fwry ]
transliteration: Ek Daro Bhat Ghail Hoe Dhar Ek Dare Bin Praan Himdare|| Paae Dare Tin Ke Su Kate Kdhoondhaath Par Tin Ke Kahoon Daarre||
translation: Someone is lying wounded and someone lifeless on the ground; somewhere there are lying chopped hands and somewhere chopped feet;

gurmukhi: eyk su SMkq huie Btvw qij qaun smY rn BUMm isDwry ] AYso su jIq BeI pRB kI ju mlyChu qy sB Xw ibD hwry ]1910]
transliteration: Ek Su Shankat Hue Bhatvaa Taj(i) Taoun Samai Ran Bhoonm Sidhdare|| Aiso Su Jeet Bhaiprabh Kiju Malechhodh Te Sabh Yaa Bidh Hdare||1910||
translation: Many warriors in a great suspense fled away from the battlefield; in this way, Krishna became victorious and all the malecehhas were defeated.1910.
